metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: HTML Links
Links are found in nearly all web pages. Links allow users to click their way from page to page.
content.html: Links are found in nearly all web pages. Links allow users to click their way from page to page.

content.text: HTML Links - Hyperlinks
HTML links are hyperlinks.
content.html: HTML links are hyperlinks.

content.text: You can click on a link and jump to another document.
content.html: You can click on a link and jump to another document.

content.text: When you move the mouse over a link, the mouse arrow will turn into a little hand.
content.html: When you move the mouse over a link, the mouse arrow will turn into a little hand.

content.text: Note: A link does not have to be text. A link can be an image or any other HTML element!
content.html: Note: A link does not have to be text. A link can be an image or any other HTML element!

content.text: HTML Links - Syntax
The HTML <a> tag defines a hyperlink. It has the following syntax:
content.html: The HTML <a> tag defines a hyperlink. It has the following syntax:

content.code_html: <a href="url">link text</a>

content.text: The most important attribute of the <a> element is the href attribute, which indicates the link's destination.
content.html: The most important attribute of the <a> element is the href attribute, which indicates the link's destination.

content.text: The link text is the part that will be visible to the reader.
content.html: The link text is the part that will be visible to the reader.

content.text: Clicking on the link text, will send the reader to the specified URL address.
content.html: Clicking on the link text, will send the reader to the specified URL address.

content.code_html: <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/">Visit W3Schools.com!</a>

content.text: By default, links will appear as follows in all browsers:
content.html: By default, links will appear as follows in all browsers:

content.text: Tip: Links can of course be styled with CSS, to get another look!
content.html: Tip: Links can of course be styled with CSS, to get another look!

content.text: HTML Links - The target Attribute
By default, the linked page will be displayed in the current browser window. To change this, you must specify another target for the link.
content.html: By default, the linked page will be displayed in the current browser window. To change this, you must specify another target for the link.

content.text: The target attribute specifies where to open the linked document.
content.html: The target attribute specifies where to open the linked document.

content.text: The target attribute can have one of the following values:
content.html: The target attribute can have one of the following values:

content.code_html: <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/" target="_blank">Visit W3Schools!</a>

content.text: Absolute URLs vs. Relative URLs
Both examples above are using an absolute URL (a full web address) in the href attribute.
content.html: Both examples above are using an absolute URL (a full web address) in the href attribute.

content.text: A local link (a link to a page within the same website) is specified with a relative URL (without the "https://www" part):
content.html: A local link (a link to a page within the same website) is specified with a relative URL (without the "https://www" part):

content.code:
Absolute URLs

W3C

Google

Relative URLs

HTML Images

CSS Tutorial
content.code_html:
<h2>Absolute URLs</h2>
<p><a href="https://www.w3.org/">W3C</a></p>
<p><a href="https://www.google.com/">Google</a></p>

<h2>Relative URLs</h2>
<p><a href="html_images.asp">HTML Images</a></p>
<p><a href="/css/default.asp">CSS Tutorial</a></p>

content.text: HTML Links - Use an Image as a Link
To use an image as a link, just put the tag inside the tag:
content.html: To use an image as a link, just put the <img> tag inside the <a> tag:

content.code_html:
<a href="default.asp">
<img src="smiley.gif" alt="HTML tutorial" style="width:42px;height:42px;">
</a>

content.text: Link to an Email Address
Use mailto: inside the href attribute to create a link that opens the user's email program (to let them send a new email):
content.html: Use mailto: inside the href attribute to create a link that opens the user's email program (to let them send a new email):

content.code_html: <a href="mailto:someone@example.com">Send email</a>

content.text: Button as a Link
To use an HTML button as a link, you have to add some JavaScript code.
content.html: To use an HTML button as a link, you have to add some JavaScript code.

content.text: JavaScript allows you to specify what happens at certain events, such as a click of a button:
content.html: JavaScript allows you to specify what happens at certain events, such as a click of a button:

content.code_html: <button onclick="document.location='default.asp'">HTML Tutorial</button>

content.text: Tip: Learn more about JavaScript in our JavaScript Tutorial .
content.html: Tip: Learn more about JavaScript in our JavaScript Tutorial.

content.text: Link Titles
The title attribute specifies extra information about an element. The information is most often shown as a tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.
content.html: The title attribute specifies extra information about an element. The information is most often shown as a tooltip text when the mouse moves over the element.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<a href="https://www.w3schools.com/html/" title="Go to W3Schools HTML 
  section">

href="https://www.w3schools.com/html/" title="Go to W3Schools HTML 
  section"

content.text: More on Absolute URLs and Relative URLs

content.code_html: <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/html/default.asp">HTML tutorial</a>
<a href="/html/default.asp">HTML tutorial</a>
<a href="default.asp">HTML tutorial</a>

content.text: You can read more about file paths in the chapter HTML File Paths .
content.html: You can read more about file paths in the chapter HTML File Paths.

content.text: Chapter Summary
HTML Link Tags
For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference .
content.html: For a complete list of all available HTML tags, visit our HTML Tag Reference.
